intro: Jambosa subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jambosa, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, are followed by capsule fruits containing several seeds.
